citeinfo.title: Arthropods of Economic Importance - Eurasian Tortricidae

descript.abstract: This CD-ROM holds an interactive identification guide and information source on economically important tortricids in Europe and Asia for all applied entomologists working in agriculture, forestry and horticulture, as well as in plant-protection and quarantine. It contains a pictorial key to the males and females of 189 species, detailed information on their taxonomy (including illustrations of external characters and genitalia, and brief descriptions of the the immature stages), and information on their life-histories, hostplants, distribution, parasitoids and attractantia. Notes on related non-pest species and diagnostic characters to distinguish them from the economically important species are also included.
descript.purpose: Provides information on economically important tortricids in Europe.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html (previous geoform was 'CD-ROM database')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

dataqual.complete: This work was compiled using the most recent literature from the best experts in the field and using unique photographs provided by numerous institutes around the world.

overview.eaover: Entity - arthropods; Associated attributes - pictorial key to the males and females of 189 species, detailed information on their taxonomy (including illustrations of external characters and genitalia, and brief descriptions of the the immature stages), and information on their life-histories, hostplants, distribution, parasitoids and attractantia.

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The Copepods CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 95/98, Pentium CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher. Macintosh: System 7.x/8.x, 680x0/PowerPC CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher.
